The Thing About Me Is...

You need to make sure you've got your Javascript enabled around me - that's for sure.

I'm the Director of Technology and the front-end developer at Custom Channels in Boulder, CO, which is to say that I spend 50+ Hours at week staring at computers. Since I spend so much time working with computers I've got a routine down - I come in in the morning, I open GNU Screen, ViM, CMUS, Chrome and VirtualBox - then I make coffee.

I'm fascinated by back-end development even though it isn't my area of expertise. I *attempt* to participate in P2PUniversity both as a teacher and a student. I've taken in classes on Rails and HTML5 Game Development and helped to admin a class on Python 101. More recently I've been working with some PHP-based MVC frameworks - hopefully those frameworks will work their way into my toolbox.

When I'm not doing web-dev stuff I spend my time brewing beer. I'm a certified BJCP judge and an award winning homebrewer. I've got my sights set on winning at the National Homebrew Competition (even though I got shut-out last year due to EVERY judging location filling up before I entered) - just like every other homebrewer in the country...

I also really like looking at clean code. I wasn't going to write this paragraph; however, when I completed the other paragraphs I went through and made sure every line was <= 100 characters and double spaced - that's right, I'm that awesome.
